description: # the project folder full path make sure to use forward slash
# name of the project (do not add extension)
# the directory where all images are being stored NB put an additional forward slash to make sure the python os.path.join command uses the correct /
# the coordinate system EPSG code (OSGB- EPSG:: 27700) EPSG::27700
# marker coordinates - Not essential. If not desired enter "NONE"
# enter the EPSG code for the crs that the marker coordinates are measures in.
# The name of an export folder (no need to create this - if it doesn't exist it will be created)
# either TRUE or FALSE for the following options (must be in caps)
# The PhotoScan image quality threshold - 0.5 as default
#  Sparse point cloud accuracy pick from: [HighestAccuracy,  HighAccuracy,  MediumAccuracy,  LowAccuracy, LowestAccuracy]
# Dense point cloud quality pick from: [UltraQuality, HighQuality, MediumQuality, LowQuality, LowestQuality]
#Mesh face count option -  pick from: [LowFaceCount, MediumFaceCount, HighFaceCount]
# options for the resolution of orthomosaic and DSM exports in metres
# keep false unless dataset is expected to be very large
# keep false unless dataset is expected to be very large
# keep false unless dataset is expected to be very large
# keep false unless dataset is expected to be very large
# tie point error reprojection limit - used to filter out "bad" tie points - this may need to be increased if too may points are removed. Leaves as 0.45 by default
# sets a threshold for the number of pairs allowed for depth map creation. If "FALSE" then this is unlimited by default
# If not enabled this value does nothing number of pairs allowed for depth filtering. 80 is conservative
# sets a threshold for the number of pairs allowed for dense cloud creation. If "FALSE" then this is unlimited by default
# If not enabled this value does nothing number of pairs allowed for depth filtering. 80 is conservative
# Enables rolling shutter correction
# Enables altitude correction in DJI images
# GNSS derived absolute height of Take off point for DJI Drone only - used to correct DJI camera absolute altitude values
# Filter_mode for buildDepthMaps choose between (NoFiltering
